page.title: 04COPMANTHORPE INTRODUCTION
page.content: Copmanthorpe is situated 4.5 south west of York and south of the A64 motorway.It is surrounded by good agricultural land used mainly for growing crops.Over the past 20 years it has grown from a small community to a large commuter village surrounded by 5 new housing estates.There is a railway line passing through the village.It is a very busy line used mainly by Inter-City 125 diesel trains .Copmanthorpe railway station opened in 1839 and closed in 1964.The village has two schools a Junior school with 250 pupils and an Infants with 180 pu_ pils.Each school has its own head tea_ cher.There are two churchs a methodist chapel built in 1958 and St Giles ch_ urch built in 1180.There is one work_ ing farm left in the village.There are 8 shops,a garage and 2 public houses. The village still has a village green.
